707858f-a.title: Manhattan: 2nd Ave. - 38th St. E.
707858f-a.text:
Second Avenue, west side, from E. 32th (left) to 39th (right) Streets, as viewed northeastward from aton No. EO1 E. 38th Street. Across the roofs of these structures are buildings in the Grand Central zone; prominent of which are the Chanin, the Commodore Hotel and the Grand Central Building (under constructionJ. To the left of the first mentioned feature is the stack of the Hupfel Brewing Co. Note the lack of the subsequently erected Chrysler Huilding which if present would obscure the view of the hotel. lIn the lower foreground is a clearance on the east side of Second Avenue between N8th and E9th Streets and is not to be confused with a similar
arranoement between 39th and 1Oth Street.
September 2, 1928.
P.L. Sperr

712450f-a.title: Manhattan: 38th Street - 2nd Avenue
712450f-a.text:
38th Street, north side, west from and including Second Avenue, showing the Hupfel Brewery at Nos. 235-225. There is a clearing
on the N.E. corner of Second Avenue.
September 2, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

712464f-a.title: Manhattan: 38th Street - 2nd Avenue
712464f-a.text:
38th Street, north side, east from 213 East, east of Third avenue, to, but not including, Second Avenue. Notice the Hupfel brewery.
September 17, 1930
P. L. Sperr.

712456f-a.title: Manhattan: 38th Street - 2nd Avenue
712456f-a.text:
38th Street, north side, east from No. 311 east of Second Avenue.
April 8, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

730133f-a.title: General view - Midtown Manhattan - East 40s.
730133f-a.text:
General View Midtown Wanhattan, East 40's: View 1 shows the Chrysler Building and portions of the Shanin (left) and News Buildings, seen across tene.ients from 38th Street near Second
Avenue.
View 2 is northeastward trom the Empire State Building acros: . the 4Pnd Street cistrict and on up toward and beyond the ueensboro Bridge anc elfare Island. In the cente is the Chrysler Building and proeceding it, the lower Chanin Building. To the left is the Rectangular-roofed Lincoln Suilding. In th left background is th white group of buildings--the New York iospital On the right of the view is the borough of Queeus. View 3 is east along 42nd Street from near Brosdway. The rear of the New York Public Library is tn the center. The buildings from left to right are: Iefcourt National, 500Fifth Avenue (under construction), Chrysler, Lincoln, Lefcourt-Colonial, 10 Easr
40th Street.
View 1: WPA Phot0.  September, 1931
View 2.3: P. L. Sperr  View 2: Sept. 1931
NO RPPRODDCTIONS  View 3: July, 1930

712451f-a.title: Manhattan: 38th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
712451f-a.text:
E. 38th Street, west from Second Avenue, showing mainly the hnorth side of tnis thoroughfare. The prominent structure is the J. C. G. Hupfel Brewery. Note the shadowy outline sf the office building No. 10 E. 40th Street, to the left of same.
January 7, 1939
Somach Phote Service
New York City Tunnel autherity

712455f-a.title: Manhattan: 38th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
712455f-a.text:
E. 38th Street, north side, east from (No. 307-313 garage left) a point to the east of Second Avenue,to the East River (right). To the right and on opposite sides of First Avenue are the Eleto Co. warehouse (erected Fall 1928) and the Consolidated Edison Co. power house. The latter is east of First Avenue and extends to the
river.
January 7, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

707864f-a.title: Manhattan: 2nd Ave. - 38th St. E.
707864f-a.text:
Second Avenue, west side, north from E. 35th (lw er left) to 42nd (upner right) Streets, as viewed northeastward from atop NIo. 301 E. 38th Street. The tenerents shown occuny the 39th 40th and 4Oth - 41st Street blocks. The white business structure seen is a portion of the News Building of which the southerly side ( north side of 41st Streetl predorinates. Obstructing the
store fronts is the Secord Avenue "E;".
View No. 2 shows orly the 39th - 4Oth Street frontage, which No. 3, being from the street level shows the N.W. corner at N9th Street and the Avenue. Overhead in this instance are the Chanin
and Chrysler Buildings.
September 11, 1931
Views 1 and 2
View 3: April 8, 1936.
P.L. Sperr

712454f-a.text:

Fall of 1936.
January 7, 1939
